snippet: In a stunning rejection of the steroid era, no players were elected into the Baseball Hall of Fame.
abstract: Editorial on no players being elected into Baseball Hall of Fame; contends that resounding rejection of even Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens--two of baseball's all-time best--is part of legacy of steroids in baseball, and transition away from steroids era will be faster if its taint is kept out of Hall of Fame.
lead_paragraph: In a stunning rejection of the steroid era, no players were elected into the Baseball Hall of Fame.
